citation.article-title: Hymenobacter tibetensis sp. nov.,a UV-resistant bacterium isolated from Qinghai–Tibet plateau

p.s: Description of Hymenobacter tibetensis sp. nov.
H. tibetensis (ti.bet.en'sis. N.L. masc. adj. tibetensis pertaining to Tibet, an autonomous region in north-west China).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming rods, approximately 0.8–1.2 μm long and 0.3–0.4 μm wide.
Motility is not observed.
Colonies on 0.1 × TSB agar are opaque brick-red-pigmented, circular, entire, of low convexity.
Colony diameter is up to 1.0 mm after 3 days incubation at 25 °C.
Growth occurs at 4–30 °C (optimum 25 °C), 0–1% (w/v) NaCl (optimum 0%), pH 5–10 (optimum pH 7), and on 0.1 × TSB agar and R2A agar but not on TSB agar, PYES agar.
Oxidase activity, catalase activity, hydrolysis of aesculin and casein tests are positive.
Negative for glucose fermentation, nitrate reduction, H2S production, indole production, citrate utilization and urease activity.

In the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, esterase C4, esterase lipase C8, leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase (weakly), acid phosphatase (weakly), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase (weakly) and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activity are detectable.
Lipase C14, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activity are not detectable.

Positive in the Biolog system for dextrin, l-arabinose, d-cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, α-d-glucose, α-d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, d-psicose, sucrose, d-trehalose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid mono-methyl ester, α-keto butyric acid, l-alaninamide, l-alanyl-glycine, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, glycyl- l-aspartic acid, glycyl-l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-threonine, and uridine.

Negative in the Biolog system for α-cyclodextrin, Tweens 40 and 80, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, adonitol, d-arabitol, i-erythritol, l-fucose, m-inositol, d-mannitol, β-methyl-d-glucoside, l-rhamnose, xylitol, formic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, d-glucosaminic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenyl-acetic acid, itaconic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, sebacic acid, l-alanine, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine, l-pyroglutamic acid, d-serine, l-serine, γ-aminobutyric acid, urocanic acid, inosine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, 2,3-butanediol, and glycerol.
Sensitive to chloramphenicol, erythromycin, gentamicin, penicillin G, polymyxin B sulphate, tetracycline and vancomycin.
The strain is resistant to UV radiation (254 nm, 10.5 min).
The quinone system is menaquinone MK-7.

Major fatty acids (>5%) are iso-15:0 (34.5%), anteiso-15:0 (6.1%), 16:1w5c (15.6%), summed feature 3 (C16: 1ω7c and/or C16: 1ω6c), (9.8%), summed feature 4 (anteiso-C17: 1 B and/or iso-C17: 1 I) (6.5%).
The polar lipid profile is composed of the major compound phosphatidylethanolamine and three unknown aminophospholipids, an aminolipid, a glycolipid and six polar lipids.
The polyamine pattern of strain XTM003T contained mainly sym-homospermidine.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 55.8 mol%.
The type strain is XTM003T (=CCTCC AB 207089T=NRRL B-51271T), isolated from the Qinghai–Tibet plateau.
